thread.title: Hull City have already conceded the most penalties in a Premier League season... with 13 games to go
thread.title_full: Hull City have already conceded the most penalties in a Premier League season... with 13 games to go

author: Mark Jones
title: Hull City have already conceded the most penalties in a Premier League season... with 13 games to go
text:
Sport Hull City have already conceded the most penalties in a Premier League season... with 13 games to go The Tigers' capacity for conceding spot-kicks is unrivalled in Premier League history, and they've got a lot of time to 'improve' on that Share All of these men have netted from the spot against Hull this season, and they aren't alone (Photo: Getty Imahes / Liverpool Echo) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Hull City are still fighting away at the foot of the Premier League table, but the appointment of new boss Marco Silva has breathed new life into their battle to avoid relegation. 
The Tigers have picked up some impressive results in recent weeks, including drawing with Manchester United at Old Trafford and beating Liverpool at home, but their struggles early in the campaign mean that they are still in the bottom three . 
And one of the main reasons for that is that they keep shooting themselves in the foot. These aren't all your fault, Marco (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 
Because incredibly, Hull have now conceded 11 penalties in the Premier League this season, beating the previous record of 10 set by Mark Hughes' Blackburn Rovers side in the 2006/07 season. 
And Hull have THIRTEEN games remaining. Sparky's Blackburn team were 'masters' at conceding spot-kicks (Photo: getty) 
The run of conceding spot-kicks began on the opening day of the campaign when Hull beat Leicester, and it has just snowballed from there. 
The full list reads: 1. Leicester, 14/08/2016 - Scored by Riyad Mahrez (Hull won 2-1) The Algerian scored from the spot back when everything in the Leicester garden was rosy (Photo: REUTERS) 2. Arsenal, 17/09/2016 - Missed by Alexis Sanchez (Hull lost 4-1) The Tigers' Jake Livermore was sent off for a handball on the goalline, and although Eldin Jakupovic saved Sanchez's kick, Arsenal still cruised to a win (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) 3 and 4. Liverpool, 25/09/2016 - Both scored by James Milner (Hull lost 5-1) Milner scores Liverpool's first penalty after Ahmed Elmohamady was sent off (Photo: Reuters) And he added a second in the second half (Photo: Julian Finney) 5. Bournemouth, 15/10/2016 - Scored by Junior Stanislas (Hull lost 6-1) On a day to forget for Hull on the south coast, Stanislas scored the first of his double from the spot (Photo: Michael Steele) 6. Southampton, 6/11/2016 - Scored by Charlie Austin (Hull won 2-1) Saints took the lead from the spot after Curtis Davies fouled Maya Yoshida, but Hull hit back through Robert Snodgrass and Michael Dawson (Photo: Getty) 7. Crystal Palace, 10/12/2016 - Scored by Christian Benteke (Hull drew 3-3) A thrilling clash featured two penalties in the opening 70 minutes, before the sides shared four goals in the final 20 (Photo: Getty) 8. West Ham, 17/12/2016 - Scored by Mark Noble (Hull lost 1-0) Hull played well at the London Stadium, but fell to Noble's penalty after Tom Huddlestone brought down Michail Antonio (Photo: Getty) 9. Manchester City, 26/12/2016 - Scored by Yaya Toure (Hull lost 3-0) Hull held out until 18 minutes from time, only for Andrew Robertson's foul on Raheem Sterling to allow Toure to open the floodgates   10. Bournemouth, 14/01/2017 - Scored by Junior Stanislas (Hull won 3-1) Stanislas netted from the spot in just the third minute of Marco Silva's Premier League career, but the Tigers hit back (Photo: PA) 11. Arsenal, 11/02/2017 - Scored by Alexis Sanchez (Hull lost 2-0) Sam Clucas was sent off for handling on the line (Hull's third such dismissal this season) and Sanchez wrapped up Arsenal's win (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Of the 11 penalties, only Benteke's and Noble's really cost Hull, but those three points that they lost as a result of them would currently place them 16th in table, and two points clear of the relegation zone. 
How about you maybe just stop conceding penalties then lads, eh? poll loading Will Hull be relegated this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
